comment: He doesn't seem to prepare well for classes and seems to be figuring out things as he "teaches". He's typically very late for every quiz and test and is not very clear on what will be on either. He sent the class information about the final on the day of. I wouldn't advise anyone to take him with the exception of him being the only option.

comment: He goes by the book and he is tough. He can quiz on very specific things about terminology and formatting. For example, he had a quiz question where you had to know the word torsion from statics. That particular word isn't really taught at my school and it's worth a letter grade on a quiz. Master your pre-reqs.

Sweigart is a good guy, he just has high expectations of his students. Meaning that if dynamics is a pre-req, you better know dynamics. I took this as a summer course so the material was accelerated and therefore more difficult, but if you put the time into learning it and going to his office hours (this is key), you will succeed. Curves heavily.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He seems like a nice guy but its very boring. He reads straight from the book so there no point in going to class. For the past 2 quizzes and test we asked him what to specifically study. He told us but then changes the test last minute. None of what he said was on the quizzes or exam. The problems on the exams were barely covered/ irrelevant.

Very un-organized. He has no set lecture plan or homework, does not grade papers in a timely fashion, and he is realy bad at understanding the questions asked in class, and therefore talks around the question. He uses a lot of industry jargon that is not in the text.
